issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: In capacity scheduler, the property is used to control whether an app with no/bad queue should be killed.  In the state store, the property controls whether a state store op failure should cause the RM to exit in non-HA mode.  Those are two very different things, and they should be separated.

comments.body: Agree. IIRC, the later one - state store operation failure cause RM fail fast is this configuration get designed for. cc [~kasha], [~jianhe]. This is to control system level risk for the whole cluster. For app w/o valid queue get submitted, we should have other configuration to identify the expected behavior.
[~djp], I think you're right.
upload v1 patch for this JIRA.
[~templedf] / [~djp] Does jenkins have any issue? I submitted the patch, and don't get the result report.

bq. Does jenkins have any issue? 
Hi [~yuanbo], it could be. I just kick off jenkins manually for your patch.
[~djp] Thanks

This message was automatically generated.

Sorry to interrupt, it has been a while since the last update.
It would be great if somebody looks into my patch and give some thoughts. Thanks in advance.
[~djp], could you take a look?  I'm not comfortable making the call for capacity scheduler.

Overall seems fine to me.  The message, "Should application fail fast if it is not with a proper queue." should probably be, "Whether applications should fail during recovery if they were submitted against a queue that is no longer valid."
Sorry for coming late on this. I will review it today!

The patch looks mostly fine. About the message, actually, this new added configuration decide whether to fail related app or fail the RM (with throw QueueInvalidException) so above messages are not precisely. May be we should use something like "Whether RM should fail during recovery if previous applications' queue is no longer valid."
Other looks fine to me.

[~djp] and [~templedf] Thanks for your review.
Upload v2 patch to address your comments.
